In Bricktales, though, it's way more granular. You're whisked away into a separate building screen to construct and stress test things like bridges and beams to support a platform, for example. You have a set number of different shaped and sized bricks to work with.
From playing a preview build of the first level - a jungle, home to some lost explorers - the thing that impresses me most about Bricktales is just how much it's like building things with actual Lego. It sounds stupid to say, but them little bricks are really astonishingly realised. It all looks so much Lego it's sort of surprising that you can't reach through the screen and pick it up. It's amazing. It's the closest thing to Lego you can get outside of actual Lego - which is the problem. It just kind of makes you miss Lego.
Read more
articles.title: Lego Bricktales recreates Lego so well that I wish it was just regular Lego

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Saber Interactive have launched their cinematic co-op survival horror Evil Dead: The Game today, Friday the 13th. No idea why they chose that date. Must be Bruce Campbell’s birthday or something.

 
Read more
articles.title: Grab your boomstick, Evil Dead: The Game is out now

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Hello, gentle listener. I'm afraid it has been a while since we went into the exclusion zone to find an episode or two of The Nate Files, our extra supporter-only podcast. This is entirely my fault; I was incautious while we were in there and accidentally refracted into an eel, and then Nate nearly ate that eel - it was a whole thing*, but I'm right as rain now. That's a-moray! Thank you for sticking with us while we got that admin sorted out. We really do appreciate your support so we can make these podcasts and do other fun things (like pay for my de-sliming). We couldn't do it without you!
Read more
articles.title: Supporter podcast - The Nate Files episode 9: All Creatures Small And Even More Small & episode 10: Don't Kinkshame The Skin Worms

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
MiHoYo have announced their new action RPG follow-up to Genshin Impact, Zenless Zone Zero, with registration for its closed beta beginning today. This one veers away from Genshin’s more traditional fantasy world towards post-apocalyptic urban science-fantasy, set in the effortlessly cool city of New Eridu. MiHoYo say this is “the last shelter for urban civilization due to the calamity”. So far, so mysterious.

 
Read more
articles.title: Genshin Impact devs unveil their next stylish action RPG, Zenless Zone Zero

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Stellaris's Overlord expansion is out now, jamming the vast scifi grand strategy game even fuller with megastructures, story events and - as is Paradox's wont - more vassals. Overlord aims to offer more control over your empires, both to let you shape them in more specific ways and also to generate more anecdotes when it all goes wrong.

As always, the expansion also releasing alongside a new free patch with balance fixes and bux fixes for all.

 
Read more
articles.title: Stellaris: Overlord is out now, adding vassals and new megastructures

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Funcom announced back in 2019 that they planned to make Dune games based on Frank Herbert's sci-fi spice and sandworms novels. They followed through by releasing 4X strategy game Dune: Spice Wars last month, and now it seems they're ramping up development on a new open world survival game set in the Dune universe.

 
Read more
articles.title: Funcom are making a multiplayer, open-world survival Dune game

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
There's presumably less pressure to keep every scrap of information secret when the game you're developing is a remake. EA Motive seem to be taking advantage of that by releasing lots of behind-the-scenes, in-development videos and streams of their work on the Dead Space remake. Then, occasionally in those streams, they offer some news. Back in March, they let it be known during a deep dive into the remake's audio that the game would release in early 2023. Now, during a livestream about the game's art, they've announced the specific release date: January 27th, 2023.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Dead Space remake gets a January 2023 release date

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Alan Wake 2 was announced at the death of last year with promise of a larger reveal to come in summer 2022. This week marks the 12th anniversary since the release of the first game, and to mark the occasion Remedy offered an update on the sequel. The update is: there won't be an update on the sequel this summer after all.

 
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2 won't be revealed this summer after all, Remedy say

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
You could fairly think of the Nvidia GeForce RTX 3090 Ti as a big, stump-necked brute of a graphics card. What better characterisation for the latest tippity-top-of-the-line GPU from Nvidia, who’ve already produced the best graphics card for 4K in the RTX 3080? But rather than be overwhelmed by its power, I personally feel more like the RTX 3090 Ti is trying to trick, tempt and seduce me, Old Testament-style. “Recommend meeeee” it whispers, coasting through another maximum settings benchmark. “Tell evvvvvvveryone these frame rates are totally worth £1879.”


But I can’t. Sorry. While I am a sucker for go-faster gear, the RTX 3090 Ti is just too far of a stretch, with its sometimes imperceptible performance differences to the £1399 RTX 3090 and a tendency towards impractically gigantic partner card models.

 
Read more
articles.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 3090 Ti review: the graphics card I want, but shouldn’t

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Techland have announced that the first story DLC for their parkour-infused survival horror Dying Light 2: Stay Human will slip from its scheduled June launch date to September. The DLC is one of two planned paid story DLCs, with the second not targeted for any specific date outside of Techland’s promised five years of post-launch support for the game.

 
Read more
articles.title: Dying Light 2's first story DLC has been delayed to September

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
We're going macro this week, so we're talking about the best writing in video games. This is a very broad topic for discussion, so that means I also get to say 'ludonarrative dissonance' (we also describe 'ludonarrative harmony' as its opposite). Please don't let this put you off, though, because we do talk about some bloody well good games.
The times being what they are, though, results in us having a long discussion of patter theft, because some dreadful American (we assume) stole the "It's me, Blorko!" tweet and then just did a much worse version of it. Hang your head in shame, whoever you are. I also went to a first communion party and ate a lot of cake, and had a run in with a very charismatic toddler who may or may not be evil.
Read more
articles.title: The Electronic Wireless Show podcast episode 186: the best writing in games

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Bethesda have just announced they're delaying Starfield and Redfall until the first half of 2023. Bethesda's RPG space epic was originally due to arrive on November 11th 2022, with Arkane Austin's first-person vampire survival game Redfall arriving sometime this summer, but now both titles have been shifted back to an unknown time between Janauary and June next year.  
Read more
articles.title: Starfield and Redfall have both been delayed until 2023

articles.author: Antony Terence
articles.description:
Leave the doormat outside long enough in Age Of Darkness: Final Stand and you might not live to see the morning. If the game’s grimdark aesthetic didn’t warn you, here’s another from me directly: this game is brutal. Be mentally prepared to start over, over and over again. The “one more round” syndrome is strong with this mashup of tower defense and strategy.


The game’s premise is simple: survive. While the standard survival mode is challenging enough to warrant hours of gameplay, Age Of Darkness’s modifiers let you amp up the carnage for a nightmarish good time. See those little creatures all over your screen like bees in an unstable hive? Now picture building a settlement over them. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Grimdark RTS Age of Darkness: Final Stand throws thousands against your frail walls

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
John Romero, legendary developer and co-creator of PC classics Doom, Quake and Wolfenstein, has announced he’s writing an autobiography entitled 'Doom Guy – Life In First-Person'. The book isn't due to be published until early next year, but does this mean the Doom movie from 2005 starring Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson is technically Romero’s biopic? Did The Rock not want to wear a wig? I’m very confused.

 
Read more
articles.title: Of course John Romero's autobiography is going to be called Doom Guy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: V dnešním díle Postřehů se podíváme na neúplný konec ransomwarové skupiny Conti, dopady ransomwarového útoku na ŘSD, možnost útoku na vypnutý iPhone i nešťastné ukládání hesel v prohlížeči Chrome.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: zprávy o smrti skupiny Conti byly značně přehnané

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Společnost Canonical začala nabírat vývojáře, kteří by se měli připojit k týmu „Ubuntu Gaming“. Vývojáři otevřeného operačního systému Haiku informují o pokroku ve vývoji za duben. Vyšel System76 Scheduler 1.2 s podporou pro SteamVR.
articles.title: Canonical nabírá herní vývojáře, Haiku vylepšuje podporu FUSE

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Fedora zakládá komunitní skupinu pro správu podpory BIOSu, přechod na GCC12 místy zrychlil běh openSUSE Tumbleweed, Wine 7.9 nepřináší téměř nic nového, KDE vylepšuje nejen integraci GTK CSD aplikací.
articles.title: HP připravuje notebook s AMD a Pop!_OS, Ubuntu 22.10 přepne zvuk na PipeWire

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Začleňovací okno Linuxu 5.19 je na spadnutí a do jádra míří patche implementující podporu Tesla FSD, Apple eFuse a NVMe pro čip M1, rychlejší USB4/TB pro Alder Lake či Intel In-Field Scan pro Xeony.
articles.title: Novinky pro Linux 5.19: autonomní řízení Tesla FSD či rychlejší USB4 / Thunderbolt

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Svatopluk Vít)
articles.description: Čteček elektronických knih už jsme viděli spoustu, většinou jsou si velmi podobné. Podíváme se ale podrobně na vlajkovou loď společnosti Pocketbook, která nabízí i barevné čtečky. Jaký je Inkpad Color?
articles.title: PocketBook Inkpad Color: fakt je ta čtečka barevná?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V šestém článku o vytváření, spouštění a řízení souběžných popř. paralelně běžících úloh v Pythonu nejdříve dokončíme popis knihovny Trio a posléze provedeme zhodnocení jednotlivých technologií.
articles.title: Souběžné a paralelně běžící úlohy naprogramované v Pythonu – závěrečné zhodnocení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Válka na Ukrajině probíhá už třetí měsíc a škody se nevyhnuly ani síťové infrastruktuře. Ta je sice v některých částech poničená, ale celkově internet na Ukrajině funguje překvapivě dobře. Proč to tak je?
articles.title: V jakém stavu je internet na Ukrajině? Většina sítě funguje díky decentralizaci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Dnes si představíme webový prohlížeč pro decentralizované služby, budeme procházet výzkumné práce, představíme si správce mapování a přesměrování portů a nakonec extrahujeme Unity assety.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (18. 5. 2022): prohlížeč pro decentralizované služby

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ceny energií skáčou v řádu desítek procent, což ovlivňuje také provoz datacenter. Ta se snaží ušetřit, ale možnosti jsou velmi omezené. Co se dá v takové situaci dělat? Může zákazník nějak cenu ovlivnit?
articles.title: Růst cen energií už musíme promítat na zákazníky, říká Martin Žídek z MasterDC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes se budeme zabývat problematikou komunikace mezi souběžně běžícími korutinami. Pro komunikaci se používají kanály, což je známý koncept, který však může přinášet řadu komplikací.
articles.title: Souběžné a paralelně běžící úlohy naprogramované v Pythonu – knihovna Trio (2)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ve hře Shotgun King: The Final Checkmate jste černý král, který však byl špatným králem a všechny figurky od něj utekly. Zato máte brokovnici. V každém tahu můžete buď pohnout králem, nebo vystřelit na cizí figurky.
articles.title: Nejdou vám šachy? Zkuste Shotgun King: The Final Checkmate

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Alokátor paměti jemalloc vychází z FreeBSD a je náhradou za standardní malloc() v Glibc. Za vývojem jemalloc stojí Facebook. Před dvěma týdny vyšla verze 5.3, předchozí verze 5.2.1 je z roku 2019.
articles.title: Alternativní alokátor paměti jemalloc 5.3 je rychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O programu NoiseTorch na odstranění šumu pozadí z mikrofonu jsme již psali. Jeho vývojář lawl na GitHubu upozornil, že jeden jeho počítač byl kompromitován a že by se raději nemělo věřit zdrojovým kódům na GitHubu.
articles.title: Vývojář NoiseTorch měl kompromitovaný počítač, probíhá audit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejneru a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 30. a 31. května. Školení proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V současnosti se nastavuje hostname z userspace, stará se o to init a používá se většinou /etc/hostname. Jsou ale některé případy, kdy je potřeba hostname ještě před přimoutováním /. Například mdadm potřebuje hostname a porovnává ho se záznamem homehost pro rozlišení lokálního pole a dočasně připojeného cizího pole.
articles.title: Jádro bude umět nastavit hostname

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Red Hat už před několika dny oznámil chystané vydání distribuce RHEL 9.0, čímž zmátl část uživatelů, kteří si mysleli, že je už nová verze venku. Došlo k tomu až teď, tentokrát už opravdu Red Hat oznámil dostupnost RHEL 9.0 pro všechny zákazníky.
articles.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 byl uvolněn pro zákazníky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Komunita okolo linuxové distribuce vydala první verzi nové varianty openSUSE Leap Micro. Jde o komunitní klon komerční distribuce SUSE Linux Enterprise Micro, která je určena pro kontejnerové a virtualizační prostředí. První verze nese označení 5.2, aby měly komunitní i komerční verze stejné verzování.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap Micro: lehká distribuce pro kontejnery a virtuální prostředí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Příští konference LibreOffice se bude konat 29. září až 1. října 2022 v italském Bolzanu. Program konference bude založen na následujících tématech: vývoj, API, rozšíření; zajištění kvality a testování software; kokalizace, dokumentace a projekty v původních jazycích; otevřený formát dokumentů, svobodné dokumenty a interoperabilita; propagace a marketing LibreOffice; diverzita a inkluze, noví přispěvatelé. Všechny přednášky budou streamovány a později budou dostupné ke stažení. The Document Foundation hledá přednášející.
articles.title: Konference LibreOffice 2022 proběhne v italském Bolzanu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze nejrychlejšího kodéru do video formátu AV1 tentokrát nepřináší velké změny, jde spíše o dílčí aktualizaci shrnující vývoj v posledním období. Phoronix uvádí, že z měření na CPU Ryzen 5000 nevyplývá, že by projekt přinesl větší výkonnostní optimalizace.
articles.title: Intel vydal SVT-AV1 1.1, přináší jen minimální změny oproti 1.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Microsoft Windows Subsystem for Linux dostává další zajímavou novinku. Díky spolupráci s Canonicalem mohou uživatelé Windows pod tímto subsystémem provozovat nejen „standardní Ubuntu“, ale také jeho vývojovou variantu, zde dostupnou jako Ubuntu (Preview). Vše je dostupné v rámci Microsoft Store.
articles.title: Ubuntu Preview, vyzkoušejte bleeding-edge Ubuntu ve Windows díky WSL 2.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Akcelerace kódování a dekódování video formátu H.264 (MPEG-4 AVC) skrze VA-API state tracker a Direct3D 12 API, tedy v podobě použitelné pod Windows Subsystem for Linux, míří do projektu Mesa.
articles.title: Microsoft přidal do projektu Mesa akceleraci H.264 skrze VA-API/Direct3D

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Sedmnáctý ročník konference OpenAlt chtějí organizátoři uspořádat jako tradiční konferenci, na které se účastníci potkají osobně. Proto jsme se vzdali tradičního termínu, který býval první víkend v listopadu, píše Jozef „JoeJoe“ Mlích na webu akce. Místo toho proběhně konference už 17. a 18. září 2022. Místo se ovšem nemění, OpenAlt proběhne v tradičních prostorách Fakulty Informačních Technologií VUT v Brně.
articles.title: OpenAlt 2022 proběhne v Brně už v září, hledá přednášející

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google na začátku roku oznámil, že ukončí podporu původní služby G Suite zdarma. Uživatelé měli buď odejít nebo přejít na placenou službu Workspace. Poté se začalo hovořit o tom, že firma připravuje zvláštní nabídku pro osobní použití a nakonec se z ní vyklubala omezená varianta Workspace Essentials Starter bez GMailu. Řadě uživatelů se ale tato varianta nelíbila, proto migrovali na jiná řešení.
articles.title: Google nechá G Suite pro osobní použití zdarma včetně vlastní domény

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Docker je dnes technologie, která proces vývoje, testování a provozování softwaru velmi zjednodušuje. Provozujte cokoliv a kdekoliv. Už nečekejte na nastavení svého serveru nebo na aktualizaci nějaké knihovny. Mějte prostředí jako součást vaší aplikace.
articles.title: Naučte se pracovat s Dockerem a kontejnery (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Organizátoři zveřejnili program tradiční konference InstallFest. Připraveny jsou dvě konferenční místnosti plné přednášek a jedna určená pro praktické workshopy. Mezi tématy najdete linuxové souborové systémy, sítě, bezpečnost, elektroniku a mnoho dalšího.
articles.title: InstallFest zveřejnil program, dvoudenní konference proběhne v červnu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Oblíbený vektorový editor Inkscape dostává po zhruba roce novou verzi. Ta přináší podporu vícestránkových dokumentů, editovatelné značky a čárkované vzory, přichytávání zarovnání na plátně (plus redesign nastavení přichytávání), nový efekt „tiling“ live path, dithering přechodů či aktualizace editoru SVG písem.
articles.title: Inkscape 1.2 vylepšuje mechanismy a rozhraní

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Aktualizace uzavřených ovladačů Nvidia řad 470 a 390 zase o kus posouvá životnost dnes již velmi zastaralých GeForce (a dalších produktů tohoto výrobce). Na světě je ovladač Nvidia 470.129.06, zaměřený mimo jiné na generaci Kepler (GeForce řad GTX 600 a 700) a také ovladač Nvidia 390.151, u nějž nejstarší podporovanou grafickou kartou je GeForce GTX 580 vydaná v listopadu 2010. Ovladač přitom řeší funkčnost na současném jádru Linux 5.17.
articles.title: Nvidia aktualizovala Legacy ovladače řad 470 a 390

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Projekt FreeBSD má novou aktualizační verzi 13.1. Ta vylepšuje podporu UEFI bootu na platformě AMD64, nástroj freebsd-update pak umí automatické snapshoty boot prostředí, což by mělo eliminovat riziko nevratných chyb při aktualizacích.
articles.title: FreeBSD 13.1 vylepšuje nejen UEFI boot a ZFS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jistě znáte vodoznak z plochy Windows 10/11, který upozorňuje na to, že máte aktivovat Windows. Podobně vypadající jednoduchou hříčkou můžete napálit kamarády v Linuxu či macOS. Napsaná zpráva může být vlastní.
articles.title: Activate Linux: napalte kamarády s Linuxem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Bat je klonem nástroje cat pro zobrazování obsahu souborů v příkazové řádce, ale je vylepšený. Umí zvýrazňováním syntaxe a integraci Gitu. Také je napsán v Rustu. Navíc je open source pod licencí Apache a zdrojové kódy naleznete na GitHubu.
articles.title: Bat je lepší cat se zvýrazňováním syntaxe a integrací Gitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Čtečky Amazon Kindle od začátku ignorovaly nejrozšířenější formát pro elektronické knihy EPUB. Podporovaly pouze svůj uzavřený formát MOBI (AZW) a od roku 2011 novější AZW3.
articles.title: Amazon Kindle bude umět poslat mailem EPUB, ale už ne MOBI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Přesně před deseti lety došlo ke světovému spuštění IPv6. Ačkoli protokol IPv4 stále dominuje globálnímu internetu, podpora IPv6 už zdaleka není pouze marginální záležitostí a celosvětově se mezi uživateli pohybuje okolo 40 %. Může to souviset i s úplným vyčerpáním zásob adres IPv4 a tedy dramatickým růstem jejich cen na téměř neregulovaném trhu.
articles.title: Letošní seminář IPv6 má program a podtitul deset let poté

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Microsoft má již nějakou dobu vlastní distribuci Linuxu CBL (Common Base Linux) Mariner, která nedávno vyšla ve verzi 2.0. CBL-Mariner je upravená distribuce Linux from Scratch a používá se v Azure.
articles.title: Microsoft má kromě distribuce CBL-Mariner i druhou CBL-Delridge

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Není vám lhostejná rychlost vašich webů? Nechcete řešit DDoS útoky ani TLS certifikáty? Nechcete kupovat drahé fyzické firewally, DDoS ochrany a loadbalancery? Potom je Cloudflare ideální pomůckou jak velmi jednoduše zrychlit a ochránit Vaše weby. Dále nabízí velmi rychlé DNS, Analytics, API a mnoho dalšího.
articles.title: Cloudflare – DNS, CDN a DDoS ochrana v jednom (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Evropská komise nedávno navrhla jednotnou nabíječku s konektorem USB-C pro všechna mobilní zařízení. Zákon ještě není přijat, ale má dobré vyhlídky. Apple u svých telefonů a tabletů však využívá o něco menší konektor Lightning. Naopak notebooky Apple jsou napájeny přes USB-C s PD.
articles.title: Apple testuje iPhone s USB-C pro rok 2023

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Magnetické pole si může převrátit i černá díra. V atmosféře přibývá helia, je tam víc i izotopu 3He. Další teorie postuluje neexistenci času. Simulace NASA ukazují, že sopky mohou klima i oteplovat. Účinný vodíkový palivový článek se obejde bez drahých kovů.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: 2D materiál dokáže uchovávat qubity při pokojové teplotě

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 20/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Po jarním Ubuntu přichází také Pop!_OS. Tails konečně povyšuje na Debian „Bullseye“, stejně tak openmediavault. Nový Fedora Linux byl vydán sice se zpožděním, ale přeci. Red Hat aktualizoval Enterprise Linux 8 a alternativní sestavení následují. Mezi to vše se vešla vydání IPFire, KaOS nebo Proxmox Virtual Environment… a na závěr letmý pohled na ruský ALT Linux.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 17-19/2022

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Zdaleka ne každý má stovky dolarů, které by chtěl utratit za softwarové upgrady svého počítače. To je také důvod, proč Goodoffer24 zastiňuje Microsoft snížením cen Windows 10 a Microsoft Office, a tím činí update mnohem dostupnějším. Můžete koupit obojí najednou a ušetřit ještě více a zde také je, co všechno můžete mít.
articles.title: Prodej softwaru v květnu: doživotní licence Windows 10 za € 11 , Office za € 23 a až 91% slevy!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Red Hat rozšiřuje portfolio cloudových služeb. Western Digital podporuje růst kapacity cloudových úložišť. Co ukázal veletrh RaPO 2022? Edge systémy vyžadují stále vyšší výkon. Lenovo představuje nové počítače Yoga.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Edge systémy vyžadují stále vyšší výkon

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 19/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Exoplanety u pulsarů. Město ze sinic funguje jako elektrárna. Planety podobné Zemi jsou obyvatelné spíše na svém počátku. Sebepoškození vlastní DNA zvyšuje odolnost rakovinných buněk vůči terapii. Teslův tajuplný elektromobil Pierce Arrow.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: V meteoritech našli i zbývající dvě nukleové báze

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled dubnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za duben 2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Hrozbám v 1. čtvrtletí dominovala kybernetická válka mezi Ukrajinou a Ruskem. Dell rozšiřuje možnosti multicloudových řešení. Objev jednosměrné supravodivosti bez magnetického pole slibuje revoluci. HPE Machine Learning Development System zrychluje nasazení umělé inteligence. Excitony mohou proudit materiálem i při pokojové teplotě
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Excitony mohou proudit materiálem i při pokojové teplotě

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 18/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Technologie mají být ve vesmíru viditelnější než samotný život. Hmotnost kvarku t a stabilita vesmíru. Svět horkých Jupiterů. Kde se berou černé díry střední velikosti.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Proč ve vesmíru hledat hlavně technosignatury

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Po 9 týdnech vývoje od vydání Linuxu 5.17 oznámil Linus Torvalds vydání Linuxu 5.18 (LKML). Přehled nových vlastností a vylepšení na stránce Linux Kernel Newbies.
articles.title: Linux 5.18

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V Ubuntu 22.10 s kódovým jménem Kinetic Kudu bude zvukový server PulseAudio nahrazen multimediálním serverem PipeWire.
articles.title: V Ubuntu 22.10 bude PulseAudio nahrazeno PipeWire

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Tavis Ormandy popisuje, jak zprovoznil 32 let starý unixový port tabulkového procesoru Lotus 1-2-3 na moderním Linuxu. Doprovodné zdrojové kódy jsou na GitHubu.
articles.title: Lotus 1-2-3 For Linux

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Po pěti měsících vývoje od vydání verze 250 byla vydána nová verze 251 správce systému a služeb systemd (GitHub, NEWS).
articles.title: systemd 251

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: HP ve spolupráci se System76 představil 14" notebook HP Dev One s procesorem AMD Ryzen 7 PRO a předinstalovaným Pop!_OS Linuxem.
articles.title: HP Dev One, notebook od HP s AMD Ryzen a předinstalovaným Pop!_OS Linuxem

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 1.61.0 programovacího jazyka Rust (Wikipedie). Podrobnosti v poznámkách k vydání. Vyzkoušet Rust lze například na stránce Rust by Example.
articles.title: Rust 1.61.0

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Správce nástroje curl Daniel Stenberg na GitHubu průběžně vytváří svou novou knihu Uncurled, v níž shrnuje své dlouhodobé zkušenosti s údržbou open-source projektu: od odpozorovaných pouček po vtipné a ne až tak vtipné příklady e-mailů od uživatelů.
articles.title: Uncurled: zkušenosti s dlouhodobou správou open-source projektu (curl)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová major verze 25.0 programovacího jazyka Erlang (Wikipedie) a související platformy OTP (Open Telecom Platform, Wikipedie). Přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu.
articles.title: Erlang/OTP 25.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Deno (Wikipedie), běhové prostředí (runtime) pro JavaScript a TypeScript, bylo vydáno ve verzi 1.22. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Deno 1.22

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Red Hat oznámila vydání Red Hat Enterprise Linuxu (RHEL) 9.0. Vedle nových vlastností a oprav chyb přináší také aktualizaci ovladačů a předběžné ukázky budoucích technologií. Podrobnosti v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 9.0

articles.description: Linus Torvalds just released Linux 5.18 on-time as the newest stable kernel release...
articles.title: Linux 5.18 Released With Intel SDSi, New CPU & GPU Features

articles.description: Unless Linus Torvalds has reservations today about the changes to land in the kernel this past week and decides to issue an extra RC, Linux 5.18 is expected to be christened as stable today and that in turn will mark the start of the Linux 5.19 merge window. Based on the "-next" activity, here is a look at the many changes expected to be merged for Linux 5.19...
articles.title: Linux 5.19 Will Be Super Exciting For Intel Customers, Many Other Features Expected

articles.description: As I've written about since last year the Mesa Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" has been working on experimental mesh shader support and more recently in Mesa Git code around task shaders for RADV have been landing. Timur Kristóf who is contracted by Valve to work on the open-source Linux graphics stack has been working on the mesh/task shader support in preparation for an upcoming cross-vendor Vulkan extension around mesh shading...
articles.title: Radeon RADV Driver Readied For Vulkan's Upcoming Mesh Shading Extension

articles.description: With NVIDIA's recent R515 Linux driver beta that ushered in their new open-source GPU kernel driver in development, NVIDIA posted a list of their known Wayland implementation issues/shortcomings affecting users...
articles.title: NVIDIA's List Of Known Wayland Issues From SLI To VDPAU, VR & More

articles.description: The PostgreSQL 15 database server will be releasing in a few months and is yet another major release to this open-source relational database system when it comes to performance...
articles.title: PostgreSQL 15 Performance Improving With Faster Sorting, Many New Features

articles.description: Back in 2019 Chinese CPU company Zhaoxin introduced "LuJiaZui" as their 16nm x86 CPU design for use from laptops up through servers. LuJiaZui is much improved from their earlier chips though still well behind AMD and Intel performance. Proper GCC compiler support for LuJiaZui was sent out again this week after their previous upstreaming attempt hadn't made it into GCC 12 due to being late in the cycle...
articles.title: Zhaoxin Tries Again To Upstream Their "LuJiaZui" CPU Support Within GCC

articles.description: With Linux 5.18 expected to be released as stable tomorrow and that opening up the Linux 5.19 merge window, feature work aimed for this next kernel should be largely wrapped up. Within the RISC-V architecture's "for-next" branch is several interesting additions...
articles.title: RISC-V With Linux 5.19 Preps "COMPAT" Mode For 32-bit Apps On 64-bit Kernels & More

articles.description: Systemd 251 is officially out this Saturday as the first feature update to this Linux init system for 2022...
articles.title: Systemd 251 Released With systemd-sysupdate Introduced, Many Other Additions

articles.description: An early change made this week to Ubuntu 22.10 in its early development state is replacing the PulseAudio sound server with PipeWire...
articles.title: Ubuntu 22.10 Switching To PipeWire For Linux Audio Handling

articles.description: The folks from the Polish open-source firmware consulting firmware 3mdeb are hosting another "OSF vPub" where they discuss open-source firmware efforts over beers in this currently-virtual event...
articles.title: An Open-Source Firmware Virtual Beer Event Is Happening Next Week

articles.title: Wine 7.9 Brings Many Fixes For Running Windows Games/Apps On Linux

articles.description: To date Pop!_OS has been System76's own Ubuntu derivative pre-loaded onto their various laptops and desktops. Rather interestingly, HP is preparing to launch a new laptop that will make use of Pop!_OS...
articles.title: HP Preparing An AMD-Powered Linux Laptop Powered By Pop!_OS

articles.description: It's been a fairly smooth week and Linus Torvalds is expected this Sunday to formally release the Linux 5.18 stable kernel. Unless he has any last minute reservations and decides to stretch it out an extra week, Linux 5.18 will be out as stable and with it comes a great deal of new features -- especially for benefiting AMD and Intel products from CPUs to GPUs...
articles.title: Linux 5.18 Preparing For Release - Especially Heavy With Many Intel & AMD Changes

articles.description: Last week the rolling-release openSUSE Tumbleweed switched to the new GCC 12 as the default system compiler and rebuilt its package set under this annual feature upgrade to the GNU Compiler Collection. For those curious here are some benchmarks before and after that GCC 12 transition for openSUSE Tumbleweed.
articles.title: openSUSE Tumbleweed's GCC 12 Upgrade Helping Performance In Some Areas

articles.description: While Mesa's RADV open-source Radeon Vulkan driver continues seeing a lot of activity on a near daily basis by developers from Valve, Red Hat, Google, and other independent contributors, AMD continues with AMDVLK as their official open-source Vulkan driver derived from their internal, closed-source Vulkan driver for Windows and Linux. Out today is AMDVLK 2022.Q2.2 as the latest open-source snapshot of this Vulkan driver...

However, Fedora will be relying more on the community to maintain that legacy boot support and as such the Fedora BIOS Boot SIG (Special Interest Group) is now established...
articles.title: Fedora BIOS Boot SIG Launched For Those Wanting To Maintain Legacy BIOS Support

articles.description: While the kernel-side Intel AMX support landed in Linux 5.16 and KVM support for AMX in Linux 5.17, other Linux patches around Advanced Matrix Extensions (AMX) remain floating around. One important patch-set was updated this week for ensuring proper power management on AMX-enabled processors, coming with Xeon Scalable "Sapphire Rapids" this year...

articles.title: AOMP 15.0-2 Released For Radeon OpenMP Compiler

articles.description: While the hostname on Linux systems is widely relied upon for different applications, setting the hostname is usually left up to user-space by the init system at boot. However, should any user-space processes try to read the system hostname prior to it being set, it could lead to unintended results. So now finally in 2022 there is a kernel parameter working its way upstream with "hostname=" should you want to ensure the hostname is set before user-space is started...
articles.title: Linux To Introduce The Ability To Set The Hostname Before Userspace Starts

articles.description: System76-Scheduler as the Linux PC vendor's effort to provide a Rust-written daemon to enhance Linux desktop responsiveness and shipping as part of their Pop!_OS distribution is out with a new feature release...
articles.title: System76 Scheduler 1.2 Released - Now Has Defaults For SteamVR, Flatpak Process Support

articles.description: Hearing "open-source", "PSP", and "security" all together got me excited with my initial reaction thinking it was about AMD's Platform Security Processor (PSP) albeit that's not the case here. Google's PSP announced today is the "PSP Security Protocol" and is designed for dealing with cryptographic hardware offloading at data center scale and used by Google already in production...
articles.title: Google Makes Public Their Open-Source PSP Security Protocol

articles.description: The Framework Laptop is a modular laptop design that launched a year ago and is designed to be upgrade-friendly and allows users for switching out lots of components from different ports to the motherboard itself. And the laptop is Linux-friendly -- see my Framework Laptop review from last year. For new systems or those wishing to upgrade their laptop's motherboard, Intel Core 12th Gen "Alder Lake" is now available...

articles.title: Intel Announces SYCLomatic For Open-Source Conversion Of CUDA Code To C++ SYCL

This Linux benchmarking bout is looking at the Xeon Platinum 8380 2P "Ice Lake" performance across Arch Linux, Debian, openSUSE, CentOS Stream, AlmaLinux, Fedora, Ubuntu, and Intel's Clear Linux.
articles.title: Intel's Clear Linux Outpacing Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, Fedora 36 & Other H1'2022 Distros

articles.title: KDE Plasma 5.25 Beta Released With Many Improvements, Wayland Support Maturing

articles.description: Last week I wrote about how well known Mesa developer Samuel Pitoiset who is employed by Valve already started working on GFX11 (RDNA3) support for RADV, the open-source Radeon Vulkan driver in Mesa that isn't officially supported by AMD but remains more popular than their own "AMDVLK" driver. More GFX11/RDNA3 preparation work remains ongoing and it's looking like if trends continue this open-source driver could be ready for RDNA3 graphics cards in time for launch...
articles.title: RADV Vulkan Driver Continues At Full-Speed Preparing For RDNA3/GFX11 GPUs

articles.description: POCL as the "Portable Computing Language" that gets OpenCL running on CPUs as well as via LLVM allowing for targeting NVIDIA GPUs, AMD HSA environments, and other cases, is now preparing to roll-out OpenCL 3.0 support...
articles.title: POCL 3.0-RC1 Released For OpenCL 3.0 Implemented On CPUs

MGLRU v11 was posted this week while we await to see if it will be mainlined come the v5.19 merge window...
articles.title: MGLRU Revved Once More For Promising Linux Performance Improvements

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Coming soon
[Update: The Switch Sports towel is now live as a reward for 550 Platinum.]
My Nintendo has been ramping up its physical reward selection as of late, and the next one in line is a Switch Sports towel.
As revealed by a news post promoting the game, the new My Nintendo reward is slated to arrive soon:
"Spocco Square is a sprawling complex where all the sports matches are held! This towel is inspired by Spocco Square from the Nintendo Switch Sports game. Handy for keeping your head in the game, wicking away sweat, or cooling off during your next match or workout!"

The lead time from an announcement to a release for a My Nintendo reward varies, but generally it can be anywhere from one to three weeks until it's up for sale. Expect it to arrive in mid-May at the latest, most likely. Based on prior reward structures, it'll probably be around 500 Platinum or more: but the Japanese Switch Sports towel reward (which is a different design) is 400.
As a reminder, if you want physical rewards, you can find our full Platinum Point guide here, which has been updated with details on weekly missions: bookmark it for when you need quick points for a reward. A handful of points is incredibly easy to get, as that’s basically just 15 minutes with Super Mario Run, or a quick sign-on to the 3DS or Wii U 3Shop. Also remember that any shipments are bundled together, so you can pay a flat rate for multiple items instead of paying it each time. Just know that items go out of stock on My Nintendo frequently, and some are never restocked.
There's free shipping on orders of $50 or more, and you can bundle cash products with the Platinum rewards if you want. You can also buy multiple My Nintendo rewards with Platinum and pay one flat rate shipping fee.
The post The next My Nintendo reward is a Switch Sports cooling towel (Update) appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The next My Nintendo reward is a Switch Sports cooling towel (Update)

articles.author: CJ Andriessen
articles.description:
Apex Legends Mobile impressions
I’m old enough and self-aware enough to know that I probably shouldn’t play competitive online shooters anymore. And it’s not because they can be insidious with their FOMO skins and seasons. I shouldn’t play them anymore because I have an addictive personality when it comes to the genre. If any of these types of games find their way onto my consoles — be it Fortnite or Overwatch or Splatoon — I risk losing myself and my free time to feed the insatiable obsession that arises after just one match. I will seriously spend an entire weekend planted in front of my television playing these games like I’m a zombie who feeds on headshots if left to my own devices.
The only place I should experience these types of games is on mobile. Because while mobile shooters can …
articles.title: Just when I thought I was out, Apex Legends Mobile pulls me back in

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Sugimori style
I can't let you get through the rest of your weekend without spotting this mock-up of a Pokemon game inspired by the watercolor style of Ken Sugimori's classic illustrations. It's a brilliant idea for a first-gen Pokemon Red/Blue/Green remake from artist @pokeyugami.
I'd be writing this article if the source was just an image, but it's a full-blown video:
https://twitter.com/pokeyugami/status/1527576053014618112
In the clip (via The Escapist), Red strolls through the forest as a few Caterpie and Weedle scooch by while a Bug Catcher boy stands guard, ready to show off his beauties.
On Twitter, a fan tacked on the Viridian Forest music for the full classic effect.
Not to tear down some of the official Pokemon remakes we've gotten over the years (most recently the chibi-ified Brilliant Diamond and Shining Pearl on Nintendo Switch last year), but dang. This fan art is so wonderful. It's how adults like me imagined Pokemon as a kid.
[caption id="attachment_323124" align="alignnone" width="1920"] The original Pokemon fantasy.[/caption]
If you're on board, you should also check out some of @pokeyugami's other work on Twitter. I love this generation-spanning Gym Leader illustration, as well as this Professor piece. Their art combines the old with the new in a novel way.
What are the odds?
Just the other day I was thinking about another similar fan project — a custom Gengar plush with Sugimori-esque painterly detailing. There's a growing passion for this stuff among creators, and a riled-up audience of fans all ready to go, cash in hand.
With the power of nostalgia and the way trends seem to circle back around, I feel like it's only a matter of time before a real Pokemon game taps into this watercolor vibe.
What is it with me getting my hopes up as a once-die-hard Pokemon fan? I need to chill!
The post This watercolor Pokemon game idea is too cool to only be a concept appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: This watercolor Pokemon game idea is too cool to only be a concept

articles.author: Chris Moyse

Good morning, friends, and welcome to Whatcha Been Playing? Look, I'll get straight to it: I still haven't finished moving house. I know, I know... but I'm old, and I have no car or friends. And if you are working, it's ok, we're all here for you whenever you find a free moment. Here's hoping for a smoo…

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Data East's '90s crossover oddity returns
And now for something completely different. The retro enthusiasts over at Hamster have taken time out from the Namco party to offer up one of the most infamous oddities of the classic arcade era. Straight out of Data East and into your hearts, it's Trio the Punch: Never Forget Me, now available on PS4 and Nintendo Switch.
Released in arcades in the spring of 1990, Trio the Punch: Never Forget Me is a delectably daft crossover beat-'em-up that stars characters from Data East's catalog, as well as some familiar, non-sequitur stages and even some iconic works of art. Players guide one of three heroes through incredibly strange side-scrolling action — fighting cities full of ninjas, monsters in the rainforest, giant robo-guardians, stacks of animals, and even the fire-breathing Data East veteran, Karnov. This is not to make mention of the moped-riding zombies, disembodied unicorn heads, or the player's enviable final form of... a sheep.
Check out the wacky antics in the video below, courtesy of YouTuber World of Longplays.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rIPtzZHJnkg
While Trio the Punch is hardly the most playable or enjoyable of classic side-scrolling actioners, the title has long cemented its place in video gaming history simply due to its nigh-on incomprehensible nature. The game does not offer any insight whatsoever in regards to plot or reason, and most on-screen text is just poorly translated (or simply garbled) gibberish. It's just a whole lot of nonsense, charmingly released as the arcade market truly started to find its feet with polished, well-produced, sensical video games. Among its contemporaries, Trio the Punch was batshit anarchy, and for that, it will remain curio in the video game hall of fame.
Trio the Punch: Never Forget Me is available to download now on PS4 and Switch, priced at $8.
The post The legendarily odd Trio the Punch: Never Forget Me joins the Arcade Archives appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The legendarily odd Trio the Punch: Never Forget Me joins the Arcade Archives

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Yet another cozy game to look forward to
The games industry is flooding with cozy, impossibly cute life simulators right now, and as a massive fan of the genre, I personally could not be happier. Titles like Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing have left an obvious mark on the market, proving time and time again that gamers are craving a simpler, sweeter life. Next up in the long list of simulators is Little Witch in the Woods, and it's looking like a real contender to stand out among the competition and be one of my favorite games of recent memory.
Little Witch in the Woods may have just entered early access, but it's already been garnering a lot of attention on Steam and Xbox (it's also playable with Game Pass).
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lS9QHk2A6yg
Players take on the role of Ellie, a young witch who takes it upon herself to collect items in the forest and help out her neighbors. Ellie also teams up with a sentient witch hat named Virgil, and works to hone her craft as an apprentice witch, an element reminiscent of Kiki's Delivery Service (which is unsurprisingly one of my favorite movies, go figure).
Early reviews say it's very similar to Stardew by way of gameplay, just with a witchy theme about it, and there's not much else you could say that would make me want to play this game more.
The developer of Little Witch in the Woods, Sunny Side Up, is reportedly very pleased with the response to the game so far, and are continued to update players. They say that the plan is for the game to get a full launch in 2023, and to add two more story chapters and an ending in addition to the prologue and first chapter that are currently available to play.
It sounds like they have a lot more game to make, but knowing that fans are already falling in love with the project so far has to be an amazing motivator. Godspeed, Sunny Side Up — we can't wait to see what else you have in store for us.
The post Adorably arcane life sim Little Witch in the Woods is in early access appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Adorably arcane life sim Little Witch in the Woods is in early access

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Regal Replica
One of the contributing factors to the enduring appeal of Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild lies in its introduction of many mythical new characters to the Zelda universe. And for those of you besotted with the underwater kingdom of Zora, First 4 Figures might have a treat in store for you.
The merch-maker has offered a first look at a brand new figurine capturing the beautiful form of Zoran princess and Champion of Hyrule, Mipha. The PVC figurine stands roughly nine inches in height and is delicately poised with her formidable Lightscale Trident. Mipha's ethereal presence and compelling beauty belie her adept combat skills and overwhelmingly courageous nature, reflected in her subtle stance.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wGeIxpNMoMo&t
Mipha stands atop a sturdy circular base, emblazoned with the symbol of the secretive "Shadow People," The Sheikah. The base features LED lighting effects, which light up her royal highness with a delectable aqua blue glow. The Mipha figurine will look mighty fine standing on anyone's bookshelf, and will make an even better accompaniment to F4F's previous releases of Princess Zelda, Revali, and, of course, Link himself.
The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Mipha figurine is available to pre-order now from the official First 4 Figures website. Mipha will retail for around $150 USD on release, but those who pre-order now can bag an Early Bird price of $137.99, not including shipping or any potential customs charges. Mipha is expected to ship in the fourth quarter of 2022 and payment options are also available.
The post The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild’s Mipha is getting her own figurine appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild’s Mipha is getting her own figurine

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
It's cool to see someone carry this torch
Not that long ago, I was out here publicly wishing that Wario Land 4 would show up on Nintendo Switch Online as my one true hail-mary GBA pick, and I'm still trying not to get my hopes up. Admittedly though, my attention is better spent on Antonblast, an upcoming PC and Nintendo Switch indie platformer that taps into the dearly departed series' vibes.
Antonblast is already winning over fans on Kickstarter, who have pushed past the game's baseline $75,000 goal on Kickstarter with a month left in the crowdfunding campaign.
If you're anything like me, the retro action-platformer footage sells itself.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GEuT3k1Y2ts
Summitsphere, the studio behind Antonblast, says it was directly inspired by Wario Land 4, Crash Bandicoot 2,…
articles.title: Antonblast has real Wario Land energy and it’s coming to Switch

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
It's an arrr-PG
Bandai Namco is showing a bit more of the battle side of its upcoming One Piece Odyssey. The role-playing game based on hit manga One Piece is launching sometime this year, and it certainly has some RPG systems in place.
When the new One Piece game was first revealed, it definitely had some RPG vibes. Some new screenshots from the Japanese One Piece Odyssey site (as spotted by RPG Site) really emphasize just how it's tackling battles, though.

There's HP and TP, as well as a weapon triangle of sorts. There are definitely some Persona vibes to the UI elements here, and I think they actually work pretty well.

Another screenshot, shown above, also highlights some positioning mechanics. It looks like range and position on the field will be important too.
Other screenshots show different members of the Straw Hat Pirates using their various abilities to navigate the environment. From slicing a gate in half to seemingly flying across the map, it looks like overworld traversal mechanics will play a role too.

Straw hat life
I am, admittedly, not a huge follower of One Piece. I've dug other Shonen Jump series like Jujutsu Kaisen and My Hero Academia, but never taken the dive on One Piece, due in large part to just how lengthy it is. My backlog is already gigantic.
That said, these screenshots are making a pretty good case for checking out One Piece Odyssey. While anime spinoffs usually veer into fighting games or other action-oriented formats, RPGs are relatively unexplored territory. Bandai Namco seems to really be going for a full-on RPG with One Piece Odyssey though, with screenshots more evocative of Persona and the Atelier series.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yogS2oJ2pZI
No firm date's been set yet, but One Piece Odyssey is due out sometime this year for PC, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, and PS5.
The post New One Piece Odyssey screenshots show off its RPG battles appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: New One Piece Odyssey screenshots show off its RPG battles

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
The little PlayStation mascot that could
The next PlayStation character to get a Nendoroid is none other than Astro from Astro Bot Rescue Mission and Astro's Playroom, and that goes to show how far this mascot has come.
I mean it! We were talking about Good Smile Company's figure for Aloy (of Horizon Zero Dawn and Forbidden West fame) just a few days ago. And now here's the humble little bot, looking like a champ. When's the next game? There's got to be another one.
https://twitter.com/GoodSmile_US/status/1527487300283801610
Good Smile Company is taking pre-orders, and you'll have until June 29 to partake. The Astro Nendoroid costs $63.99, and it's aiming to ship in February 2023, but as Siliconera points out, these things have a tendency to slip. You'll need some patience either way.
Aside from the default face, Astro also comes with swappable "dizzy" and "smiling" expressions, as well as accessories: a fuse, a PlayStation coin, and laser feet.
I love this design as is, and it's a natural fit for the Nendoroid line, but one thing is missing. Imagine if they recreated some of the collectible PlayStation console "artifacts" from Astro's Playroom. The pack-in PS5 game was such a nostalgic, nod-filled collect-a-thon.
The Astro Bot figure is so cute and pure, I feel guilty for neglecting Astro's Playroom — a game I got all of the trophies for but admittedly haven't thought about much since the PS5 launched. I should download that again (you can never have enough free space...) and try to improve some of my times. Or maybe I'll just pop back in to soak up the jams.
The post This Astro Bot Nendoroid is such a cutie appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: This Astro Bot Nendoroid is such a cutie

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Fear the power of the Edge!
BattleTanx was 3DO’s first N64 game and a pretty decent success for a company that was trying to pivot from their failed hardware endeavor. As 3DO would soon prove, they were crazy about franchises and sequels. It’s not surprising that BattleTanx would be up for a new entry the very year after it launched.
Creative director, Michael Mendheim, was nice enough to humor some of my questions about BattleTanx, so it seemed natural to also pivot to its sequel. Here’s the thing: even though he’s credited as creative director for BattleTanx: Global Assault, he wasn’t heavily involved in its design. According to him, “My involvement in BattleTanx: Global Assault was mostly just pre-production just to make sure nothing went off the rails.”

Off the Rails
“BattleTanx was a…
articles.title: BattleTanx: Global Assault was more than a worthy follow-up

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
A toggle to help with motion sickness
Has it really been a year since PowerWash Simulator launched on Steam? It has! It turns out that time flies when you're meticulously blasting away gunk with a pressure washer. If you like the idea of this surprisingly resonant sim but are waiting until it hits version 1.0, it's still in Early Access — but it's getting closer, as evidenced by this week's Birthday update. There's a new Aim Mode in PowerWash Simulator to help reduce motion sickness.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uW-u1WCtPAI
The developers hope that Aim Mode will chip away at "one of the biggest barriers to a minority but significant group of players." Basically, it's a toggle (using "C" or pressing up on the D-pad) that lets you aim your washer independently, so the camera will stay sti…
articles.title: PowerWash Simulator has a helpful new Aim Mode in its Birthday update

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
I'm still having nightmares about those tiny teeth
Who could forget ugly Sonic? After his horrifying design was announced to the world with a poster for the live-action Sonic the Hedgehog movie, he became one of the biggest memes of 2019. Fans, myself included, were disgusted by how human-like he was, especially when it came to his hands, eyes, and teeth. Following the tidal wave of backlash online, the studio finally decided to completely revamp Sonic's design for the live-action movie, and it actually worked out for the better. But it seems that no one has forgotten, and certainly not forgiven.
So when the new Disney+ movie Chip 'N Dale: Rescue Rangers featured a main plot thread of a wide variety of animated characters living alongside humans a la Who Framed Roger Rabbit?, the film's di…
articles.title: Ugly Sonic is back to haunt us in Chip ‘N Dale: Rescue Rangers

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Polygonal Phantasies
In a little over a month's time, we will be welcoming old-school gaming hero Klonoa back into our humble little lives. Bandai Namco is preparing for the release of the remastered Klonoa Phantasy Reverie Series on PC and consoles, and has dropped a short, nostalgia-sparking clip from the retro adventures.
As previously reported, Klonoa Phantasy Reverie Series is a compendium containing remasters of the 2008 Wii release Klonoa: Door to Phantomile (itself a remake of the 1997 PlayStation original) and the 2001 PS2 sequel Klonoa: Lunatea’s Veil. Developed by Monkeycraft, the two games have been lovingly restored with sharp HD visuals, 60 FPS gameplay, and boosted with new features, including rebalanced difficulty options and an all-new two-player co-op mode.
2022 sees Klonoa celebrate their 25thn birthday, so now is the perfect time to release this delightful looking retrospective of their most memorable adventures. Sadly, the compendium will not contain all of the Klonoa titles — so you won't find their Game Boy Advance or Wonderswan adventures herein — but it will at least be fun to visit the charming world of Lunatea, looking fresher and more colorful than ever before.
Klonoa is one of a number of somewhat forgotten gaming heroes making a grand comeback, so it's a pretty rad time to be a fan of classic platforming adventures. Klonoa Phantasy Reverie Series launches July 8 on PlayStation, PC, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch platforms.
https://twitter.com/BandaiNamcoEU/status/1526956304140587009?s=20&t=5d04ZoEat3YvwIRds0YKWQ
The post Klonoa Phantasy Reverie Series hits July, and here’s a small snippet appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Klonoa Phantasy Reverie Series hits July, and here’s a small snippet

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Edelgard and co. get some new duds
The next faction spotlight for Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes is here, and it's all about Edelgard and the Black Eagles.
The Adrestian Empire is the banner they'll be fighting under, but Three Houses players will remember this motley crew as the Black Eagles. Edelgard is here, of course, but in today's trailer we get to see all the former students in action.
There are some neat touches here, considering the variety of skillsets in the Black Eagles. Two little aspects I dug were Dorothea using singing as a weapon, and Petra's big attack utilizing a bow (since she is an Assassin class when you fight her in other houses' campaigns).
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2EGQ3oKDcj0
Two houses down, one to go
That's two of Fire Emblem: Three Houses' big factions down, one left to go. It looks like since we have Black Eagles and Blue Lions covered, the Golden Deer will be the last crew to get a spotlight.
That said, it's impressive to see how every student in each house is a full-on playable character in Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes. With just the three houses and protagonist Shez, that's 25 characters.
I'm curious to see if we get any of the school staff or the endearing basement goths from the Ashen Wolves campaign. And I'd be really surprised if Anna, the series' long-running "mascot" merchant, doesn't also make an appearance.
I'm hopeful (ha) that Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes will turn out as a pretty good musou game, as the Nintendo crossovers have run the gamut. The Hyrule Warriors side has been generally solid to pretty darn good. But Fire Emblem Warriors missed some of that spark.
With a laser focus on just Fódlan and the world of Fire Emblem: Three Houses, maybe Three Hopes can make the Warriors side click. Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes hits Nintendo Switch on June 24.
The post Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes trailer shows off the Black Eagles’ new looks appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes trailer shows off the Black Eagles’ new looks

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Bring back that lovin' feelin'...
It's been some time since we last heard from action-packed sky-flier Ace Combat 7, but would-be pilots will certainly be feeling the need for speed come May 26, when Bandai Namco drops a batch of brand new DLC based on Paramount Pictures' upcoming blockbuster Top Gun: Maverick. 
The Ace Combat 7 — Top Gun: Maverick Aircraft Set DLC adds two new skyfighters to the game's hanger. First up is the stunning F/A-18E Super Hornet, as flown by Top Gun's white-teethed, cheesy-grinnin' hero Pete "Maverick" Mitchell, portrayed in the movie series by alien daredevil Tom Cruise. Oh, and for those of you who truly want to take it right-in-to-the danger zone, then it seems that a replica of Maverick and Goose's F-14A Tomcat from the 1986 movie is also included.
The trailer below spotlights the F/A-18E Super Hornet, as well as the movie's fret-wanking theme.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a7ujkyWqbfo
Released way back in 2019, which today feels a whole world away, Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown was a hit with the dedicated Ace Combat community, who celebrated its snazzy visuals, frenetic gameplay, and surprisingly deep lore. The initial release would be followed by a slew of extra missions and aircraft updates. While the game is certainly in its twilight years today, this Top Gun: Maverick crossover is an absolute no-brainer, and will be likely very welcome among the game's long-time community of players.
Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown is available now on PS4, PC, and Xbox One. Top Gun: Maverick premieres in theaters May 27 and is, apparently, an excellent sequel, with some reviewers going as far as to say that it surpasses the original. Jennifer Connelly is in it, so that seems a given, to be honest.
The post Top Gun: Maverick DLC jets into Ace Combat 7 next week appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Top Gun: Maverick DLC jets into Ace Combat 7 next week

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Pushing for Carbon Neutrality by 2040
PlayStation owner Sony Corporation has announced that it is accelerating its environmental upgrade plans by 10 years. In a new statement (as noted by Eurogamer), the industry giant announced that it would be bringing its "Road to Zero" green efficiency plan forward, with an aim of severely reducing its carbon footprint within the coming decades.
Sony is looking to achieve its ambitious renewable energy goals by revising the power input and output of its global network of offices and production plants. The PlayStation publisher will be looking to install solar panels at its various international locations, whilst exploring other energy-saving measures. The company hopes to have increased its renewable energy usage to 35% by 2025, and 100% by 2030.
In addition, Sony hopes to be fully carbon neutral by 2040, while also ensuring that its wide variety of home entertainment products also produce less planet-harming emissions and run as energy-efficiently as possible. The climax of the "Road to Zero" plan would see Sony achieve its "zero environmental footprint throughout the lifecycle of Sony's products and business activities" goal by the year 2050.
For more details on the updated Road to Zero plan, check out Sony's official statement.
The post Sony revises green goals, aims for 100% renewable energy by 2030 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sony revises green goals, aims for 100% renewable energy by 2030

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Get in The Lab
After a nigh-on 18-month hype period, Nexon is finally preparing to unleash its good-looking fighter DNF Duel upon the world. As we edge ever closer to its June 28 launch date, the publisher is spittin' out new trailers left, right, and center — even affording the fighter's Practice Mode its own spotlight!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMmd77abac0
The trailer offers us a glimpse of DNF Duel's Training and Tutorial modes, which hope to get newcomers up and running while helping veteran fighting game players adapt to DNF Duel's flow and mechanics.
We can see from the video that the Training Mode is packed out with all of the requisite options, including gauge management, record/playback functions, character stances, wake-up practice, and much more. In addition, the tutorial offers playable trials teaching players basic movement all the way up to performing DNF Duel's attractive and dynamic Supers.
An adaptation of Korean MMO Dungeon Fighter Online, DNF Duel is developed by fighting game veterans Eighting and Arc System Works, which automatically lend the new title a solid sense of quality and legitimacy. It will be an uphill battle for the plucky upstart to find its name among the Tekkens and Street Fighters of the scene, but it's looking like a pretty slick scrapper, and I'm excited to check out the final product.
DNF Duel launches June 28 on PlayStation and PC platforms. Be sure to check out the previous trailers introducing us to characters for Berserker, Grappler, Hitman, Inquisitor, Striker, Ranger, Dragon Knight, Vanguard, Kunoichi, Crusader, and Ghostblade.
The post DNF Duel’s Practice Mode apparently deserves its own trailer appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: DNF Duel’s Practice Mode apparently deserves its own trailer

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
2 Death 2 Stranding
Well, it looks like more Death Stranding is on the way. Norman Reedus, star of The Walking Dead TV series who played Sam "Porter" Bridges in Death Stranding, seems to have just confirmed a part two in a new interview.
In an interview with LeoEdit (spotted by GamerUP), Reedus is asked about filming for the Death Stranding video game. To which he responds, "We just started the second one."
In a follow-up question, Reedus tells the story of how he and Hideo Kojima met through mutual friend Guillermo Del Toro. He describes seeing an early version of Kojima's Silent Hill project. Reedus committed and well, the rest is long, fraught video game history.
"It took me maybe two or three years to finish all the MoCap sessions and everything," said Reedus. "It takes a lot of work. And then the game came out, and it just won all these awards, and it was a huge thing, so we just started part two of that."
Well, that certainly reads like two confirmations of a new Death Stranding.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QlLEmu8c-Vk
Bridging the gap
Kojima has teased a bit about his next project in the past. In June 2020, he posted some images of his workspace as he worked on a new title with Yoji Shinkawa, one of his longtime collaborators. Fans at the time even spotted the word "Bridges" on some concept art.
But Kojima has also been rumored to up to several different projects. A report indicated he was working with Microsoft for an Xbox game. And he also told Famitsu that his next project is a big title that is a "new challenge."
Death Stranding did get a Director's Cut last year, adding new content and tools for Sam to make the journey across America. We haven't had any indication of a sequel until now though. But according to Norman Reedus, I guess we can look forward to a possible new Death Stranding.
The post Norman Reedus says there’s a second Death Stranding on the way appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Norman Reedus says there’s a second Death Stranding on the way

articles.author: Noelle Warner

There is just so much Pokémon anime out there, and yet it's always so good, it never feels like enough. Thankfully, the first installment of a brand new three-episode Pokémon anime web series just dropped: Hisuian Snow, which is set in the Hisui region of Pokémon Legends: Arceus. The mini-series is produced by Wit Studio, which famously created the hit anime series Attack on Titan. Ken Yamamoto, who worked on Princess Connect! Re:Dive as an episode director, serves as director for Hisuian Snow, and Taku Kishimoto of Fruits Basket, Haikyu!! fame is the lead screenwriter.
Hisuian Snow centers on a young man named Alec, who had been told his whole life that Pokémon and humans cannot coexist peacefully. When he wan…
articles.title: This beautiful Pokemon anime web series is produced by the studio behind Attack on Titan

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
The old waiting game...
Square Enix has splurged out on a selection of mysterious trademarks, recently filed in Japan and seemingly related to its iconic RPG title Final Fantasy VII Remake as well as multiple unknown IPS.
The first of the three trademarks, as noted by Gematsu, is for Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade. A title that is already available on PS5 and PC via Epic Games Store. The trademark could suggest that a re-release is being prepared, perhaps for the PC via the Steam Store or for another platform entirely.
The other two trademarks are a total mystery, and see the publisher lay claim to "Final Bar Line" and "Labyrinth Striker." Interestingly, both titles sound like they'd be more fitting as subtitles than actual game names, which has led some to theorize that they may represent spin-offs from some of Square's franchises, such as Kingdom Hearts, Bravely Default, Dragon Quest, Octopath Traveler, or, of course, Final Fantasy itself.
For now, it all remains little more than speculation. But, with another summer of gaming reveals up ahead, it will be interesting to see if any of these new names will be coming into play in the latter half of 2022.
The post Square Enix files mystery Final Fantasy VII, Labyrinth Striker, and Final Bar Line trademarks appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Square Enix files mystery Final Fantasy VII, Labyrinth Striker, and Final Bar Line trademarks

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Player Toxicity Expected
Funcom has released a new trailer for its upcoming doomsday shooter Metal: Hellsinger — the new video features the unmistakable vocals of Serj Tankian, long-time frontman of metal band System of a Down. Tankian joins a roster of metal legends that will soundtrack the next-gen shooter's violent chaos.
"What can you even say! We have so many System of a Down fans in the studio, adding Serj Tankian to our already incredible roster of vocalists feels unreal," said David Goldfarb of developer The Outsiders. "He completely killed the track and made it his own in a way only Serj could. We are so excited and can’t wait to see everyone playing!"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vig4_lsrpto
As FPS fans will immediately note, Metal: Hellsinger features the typically apocalyptic vibe of the genre's roots, founded in titles such as Doom, Hexen, Quake, and Heretic. In a fun new twist on the classic first-person gameplay, however, players will be rewarded for their ability to run 'n' gun to the beat of the game's bass-pounding score, chaining together combos and meaty acts of destruction in time with the music — a gimmick similarly explored to solid effect in 2021 release BPM: Bullets per Minute.
Tankian joins a horn-throwing roster of composers that already includes Arch Enemy's Alissa White-Gluz, Trivium's Matt Heafy, and the dulcet tones of Lamb of God's Randy Blythe. More artists are expected to be announced in the near future. It feels as though Mike Patton should most definitely be here, but the Faith No More/Fantomas frontman is currently taking a well-earned sabbatical from work, so that may just be wishful thinking on my part.
Metal: Hellsinger is currently in development for PS5, PC, and Xbox Series X.
The post SOAD’s Serj Tankian joins metal legends to score Metal: Hellsinger appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: SOAD’s Serj Tankian joins metal legends to score Metal: Hellsinger

Classic PlayStation games are coming to PS4 and PS5 in June with the new $120-per-year PlayStation Plus Premium tier, and as it turns out, they'll have trophies — at least, some of the games will. articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Fans create the games they want to see in the world
With the disappointing release of Fallout 76 almost five years behind us, fans of the series are itching for any and all updates on the future of the beloved IP. Bethesda, on the other hand, seems to have its hands full with Starfield and the next Elder Scrolls title, so the odds of getting any new official Fallout are looking pretty slim. Thankfully, the fans are willing to take things into their own hands, because the Fallout modding community just dropped a huge bomb, as it were: Fallout London, a DLC-sized story mod of Fallout 4 that explores life after the nuclear apocalypse in England.
Fallout London's development team released a gameplay trailer that clocks in at just over eighteen minutes long, which first shows scenes of various …
articles.title: Fallout London is a DLC-sized mod that takes the series across the pond

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Fans are up in arms, but I think they have a point
The Iron Giant was an important movie to me growing up. I always loved the animation style, and although it's a movie that's known for being a tear-jerker, it earns it with some excellent writing. It's a shame that Warner Bros. Animation shut down in 2004, because they had some truly iconic films back in the day. I don't know anyone who wasn't touched by the story of friendship and pacifism that we saw from The Iron Giant. I think a lot of us who grew up with the film feel a bit protective over it because of how earnest it was — or at least, that's how I feel. That's why I'm up in arms about the Iron Giant kicking some ass in MultiVersus, and I know I'm not the only one who feels that way.
After seeing our favorite giant robot on the game'…
articles.title: MultiVersus director says the Iron Giant is fighting because it’s an “alternate universe”

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Aiming to be "the most accessible God of War ever"
Last we heard, the team at Santa Monica Studio was "heads down, hard at work" on God of War Ragnarok, with nothing new to show just yet. Today, the developers had something fresh to share about the sequel's expanded accessibility features — including better controller remapping and "more customization to our combat and interaction system."
According to lead UX designer Mila Pavlin, God of War Ragnarok will bring back accessibility features that players saw in the PC version of God of War (2018): auto sprint, an always-on reticle, and a "hold" or "toggle on/off" option for the aim stance and shield stance.
Those are just some returning options. In a PlayStation Blog post outlining some of the new features (with image and video examples incl…
articles.title: God of War Ragnarok is making a bigger push for accessibility

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Learning from Picasso's iconic art style
Photorealism in games can be really fun. Having characters and environments that look just like real life can help immerse you in a game's world, and it can be exciting to see how graphics continue to improve year after year. But here's the thing — I sometimes feel like we can obsess a bit too much over how real or not real a certain game's art style is, picking apart every environment and every little detail on the character models.
I think back to the PS1 era, when people thought that the first Metal Gear game was as realistic-looking as they come. Players gushed about the immersion because of how lifelike it was. We laugh about it now, but anecdotes like that really speak to how much our minds fill in the gaps when it comes to storytelling, somet…
articles.title: Painting with pixels: how stylized art can heighten a game’s narrative
